c.description:
The general configuration object
This section is optional, and default values will be used if you don't use it.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration

b.description:
Invoke setup mode
Inputs that can be used to enter setup mode

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Buttons-to-invoke-setup-mode

cd.description:
Set delay in seconds before first accessory creation

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Initial-delay

ct.description:
Customized device category

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#HomeKit-Device-Category

1	Other
2	Bridge
3	Fan
4	Garage Door Opener
5	Lightbulb
6	Door Lock
7	Outlet
8	Switch
9	Thermostat
10	Sensor
11	Security System
12	Door
13	Window
14	Window Covering
15	Programmable Switch
16	Range Extender
17	IP Camera
18	Video Doorbell
19	Air Purifier
20	Heater
21	Air Conditioner
22	Humidifier
23	Dehumidifier
24	Apple TV
25	HomePod
26	Speaker
27	Airport
28	Sprinkler
29	Faucet
30	Shower Head
31	Television
32	Remote Controller
33	Wifi Router
34	Audio Receiver
35	TV Set Top Box
36	TV Streaming Stick

e.description:
Set a custom Gratuitous ARP packet period

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Gratuitous-ARP-Period

f.description:
Binary input debounce filter

NOTE: The binary input filter value is used for all binary inputs defined in the MEPLHAA script.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Binary-Input-Filter

h.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous HomeKit Clients.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#HomeKit-Clients

ic.description:
I2C bus declaration

Each bus must have these settings: [ SCL, SDA, Frequency ]

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#I2C-Bus

l.description:
GPIO line the status LED is connected to

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#status-led

m.description:
Setup mode timeout
Time after boot setup mode can be invoked

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Setup-Mode-Timer

oneOf.description: Integer value specifying number of seconds
Disable. Always respond to setup mode requests

mc.description:
MCP23017 GPIO Expansion interface

Each MCP23017 interface must be declared with an array:[ Bus, Address, Channel A, Channel B ]

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#MCP23017-Interface

n.description:
Custom Hostname
Custom hostname to use for the device

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Custom-Hostname

ntp.description:
String with desired NTP server (IP Address or FQDN)

Defaults to Gateway IP address provided by DHCP server

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#ntp-server

o.description:
Log Output
UART and network log output type

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Log-output

0	Disable log output (default)
1	Enable UART0 log output
2	Enable UART1 log output
3	Enable Network log output.
4	Enable UART0 & Network log output
5	Enable UART1 & Network log output
6	Enable Network log output with buffer
7	Enable UART0 & Network log output with buffer
8	Enable UART1 & Network log output with buffer

ot.description:
Log Server
Host and port to send UDP network logs

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Log-server

pt.description:
Ping Action Period
Time between ping actions

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Ping-Action-Period

r.description:
UART Configuration
Array of UARTs for use with UART Actions

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#UART-Configuration

s.description:
HAA Setup Service
Set accessory number where HAA Setup Service will be

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#HAA-Setup-Service

sn.description:
Serial Number Prefix
Customise serial number provided to HomeKit on pairing

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Serial-Number-Prefix

tt.description:
Timetable Actions
Actions that occur when configured time and date

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#timetable-actions

ttl.description:
mDNS TTL
Configurable option to set the TTL value of the mDNS entry held for the device.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#homekit-mdns-ttl

prefixItems.description:
Period
If period is not given, it will be same value as TTL.

u.description:
Unsecure Rest API
Enable / Disable HomeKit unencrypted Rest API

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Enable-Unsecure-HomeKit-rest-API

oneOf.title:
Enable Unsecure Rest API
Enabling this is NOT recommended for security reasons

ul.description:
UART Receiver Lengths
UART Receiver minimum and maximum length

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#UART-Receiver-Lengths

w.description:
Ping Gateway Watchdog
Number of consecutive ping failures before reconnection

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Ping-Gateway-Watchdog

z.description:
Setup Mode Toggle Count
Count of times I/O must be toggled to enter setup mode

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#Setup-Mode-Toggle-Count

zc.description:
Zero Cross GPIO
Enables PWM to be used by Zero-Cross detection

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/General-Configuration#zero-cross-gpio

a.description:
Accessory Configuration
This section is mandatory. It contains an array of HomeKit accessories that are available on your device.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration

then.description:
Switch
A switch can be defined as a Switch or an Outlet. Both types have the same set of options available to them.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Switches

0.description:
Action - Off

The default action after boot unless the Initial State has been set

a.description:
Copy Action
Shorthand format for copying an action

NOTE: Within an action the copy action type "a" is mutually exclusive to all other actions and can only be used on its own. All other action types can be combined.

r.description:
Binary Output Action
Change state of a GPIO

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Binary-Outputs

items.description:
Binary Output

The binary output array contains a list of GPIO level changes to perform when an action is invoked

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#output-gpio

g.description:
Output GPIO

GPIO changed on result of an action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#output-gpio

i.description:
Inching

Time period in seconds before returning pin to previous state

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Inching

v.description:
Value

Binary level to apply to the output GPIO

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Value

n.description:
Initial Value

Initial value when is declared for first time

m.description:
Service Notification Action

Send notification to a service within same device

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Service-Notifications

s.description:
System Action

Perform a system action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#System-Actions

oneOf.description: Search for OTA firmware update (only if firmware installed via OTA method)
Reconnect to Wifi resetting network interface

items.description:
Network Request Action

Send Network request actions can be used to initiate a TCP or UDP request to a specified target host and URL when an action occurs.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#send-network-request-actions

m.description:
Method

HTTP Method

c.description:
Content

Content to send in HTTP request

w.description:
Wait for response

Time to wait for a response when a TCP/HTTP request is sent

items.description:
IR Action

Send IR Codes

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Send-IR-Code-Actions

x.description:
Frequency

IR frequency in KHz. Overrides the global setting defined in the General Configuration for this action only.

r.description:
Repeats

Number of times the IR code will be repeated.

d.description:
Inter-Repeat Delay (ms)

Delay in milliseconds between repeats.

c.description:
Command

IR command to transmit

At least one definition of the Protocol ("p") must exist, either in the General Configuration section, in the accessory ("a") object, in any extra service, or in the action ("p") object.

w.description:
Raw Code

The raw IR code in HAA format to transmit

NOTE: If "w" and "c" options are defined for the same action then the "c" option will take precedence and the "w" definition will be ignored.

n.description: The UART Number defines the UART port to use.

oneOf.description: UART0 and HEX format command default

d.description:
Inter-command Delay

Delay between each transmitted command

c.description:
Set Characteristic Actions

Read value from a service characteristic and write it in other

a.description:
Copy Action
Shorthand format for copying an action

NOTE: Within an action the copy action type "a" is mutually exclusive to all other actions and can only be used on its own. All other action types can be combined.

r.description:
Binary Output Action
Change state of a GPIO

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Binary-Outputs

items.description:
Binary Output

The binary output array contains a list of GPIO level changes to perform when an action is invoked

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#output-gpio

g.description:
Output GPIO

GPIO changed on result of an action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#output-gpio

i.description:
Inching

Time period in seconds before returning pin to previous state

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Inching

v.description:
Value

Binary level to apply to the output GPIO

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Value

n.description:
Initial Value

Initial value when is declared for first time

m.description:
Service Notification Action

Send notification to a service within same device

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Service-Notifications

s.description:
System Action

Perform a system action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#System-Actions

oneOf.description: Search for OTA firmware update (only if firmware installed via OTA method)
Reconnect to Wifi resetting network interface

oneOf.description: UART0 and HEX format command default

d.description:
Inter-command Delay

c.description:
Set Characteristic Actions

Read value from a service characteristic and write it in other

b.description:
Digital Inputs

GPIOs that invoke specific actions

items.description:
Binary Input
Binary inputs array e.g. buttons, are defined by the "b" key within an service object.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Binary-Inputs

f.description:
Binary Input Filter

NOTE: The binary input filter value overrides the general option "f" when defined for a service.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#binary-input-filter

t.description:
Press Type

This option defines the type of press required on an input to initiate an action.

You can have the same binary input / GPIO with different press types attached to different services or functions.

m.description:
Mode

This option defines the mode of the binary input signal.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Mode

i.description:
Inching Time (seconds)

Time period before returning service to off state

The Inching Time is an accessory option that defines a time period for a service to return to the previous state e.g. If the inching time is set to 10 seconds a switch would turn off 10 seconds after turning on.

f0.description:
Perform Action - Off (0)

The action to perform when the switch is turned off

items.description:
Binary Input
Binary inputs array e.g. buttons, are defined by the "b" key within an service object.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Binary-Inputs

f.description:
Binary Input Filter

NOTE: The binary input filter value overrides the general option "f" when defined for a service.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#binary-input-filter

m.description:
Mode

This option defines the mode of the binary input signal.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Mode

f1.description:
Perform Action - On (1)

The action to perform when the switch is turned on

Service Notifications

ks.description:
Initial Lock State

Lock state at boot

s.description:
Initial State

The initial state of the switch at boot

oneOf.description: Opposite to last state before restart

d.description:
Maximum use time (seconds)

Maximum time the service can be on

xa.description:
Actions on Boot

Actions to perform when the device boots

GPIO changed on result of an action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#output-gpio

i.description:
Inching

Time period in seconds before returning pin to previous state

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Inching

v.description:
Value

Binary level to apply to the output GPIO

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Value

n.description:
Initial Value

Initial value when is declared for first time

m.description:
Service Notification Action

Send notification to a service within same device

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Service-Notifications

s.description:
System Action

Perform a system action

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#System-Actions

oneOf.description: Search for OTA firmware update (only if firmware installed via OTA method)
Reconnect to Wifi resetting network interface

items.description:
Network Request Action

Send Network request actions can be used to initiate a TCP or UDP request to a specified target host and URL when an action occurs.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#send-network-request-actions

m.description:
Method

HTTP Method

c.description:
Content

Content to send in HTTP request

w.description:
Wait for response

Time to wait for a response when a TCP/HTTP request is sent

items.description:
IR Action

Send IR Codes

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Send-IR-Code-Actions

x.description:
Frequency

IR frequency in KHz. Overrides the global setting defined in the General Configuration for this action only.

r.description:
Repeats

Number of times the IR code will be repeated.

d.description:
Inter-Repeat Delay (ms)

Delay in milliseconds between repeats.

c.description:
Command

IR command to transmit

At least one definition of the Protocol ("p") must exist, either in the General Configuration section, in the accessory ("a") object, in any extra service, or in the action ("p") object.

w.description:
Raw Code

The raw IR code in HAA format to transmit

NOTE: If "w" and "c" options are defined for the same action then the "c" option will take precedence and the "w" definition will be ignored.

n.description: The UART Number defines the UART port to use.

oneOf.description: UART0 and HEX format command default

d.description:
Inter-command Delay

Delay between each transmitted command

c.description:
Set Characteristic Actions

Read value from a service characteristic and write it in other

items.description:
Binary Input
Binary inputs array e.g. buttons, are defined by the "b" key within an service object.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Binary-Inputs

f.description:
Binary Input Filter

NOTE: The binary input filter value overrides the general option "f" when defined for a service.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#binary-input-filter

t.description:
Press Type

This option defines the type of press required on an input to initiate an action.

You can have the same binary input / GPIO with different press types attached to different services or functions.

m.description:
Mode

This option defines the mode of the binary input signal.

https://github.com/RavenSystem/esp-homekit-devices/wiki/Accessory-Configuration#Mode
